title: 110_hr333
content: The Act is titled the "Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act" and allows military retirees with service-connected disabilities to receive both retired pay and veterans' disability compensation concurrently. The Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act allows military retirees with service-connected disabilities to receive both retired pay and veterans' disability compensation concurrently. Amendments include the inclusion of retirees with service-connected disabilities rated less than 50 percent and disability retirees with less than 20 years of service. Phase-in of concurrent receipt of retired pay and veterans' disability compensation is repealed. Amendments to the Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act include allowing disability retirees with less than 20 years of service to receive concurrent retired pay and veterans' disability compensation. This involves redesignating subsections and making clerical amendments. Amendments allow disability retirees with less than 20 years of service to receive concurrent retired pay and veterans' disability compensation. Clerical amendments include redesignating subsections and updating section headings. Members eligible for retired pay can now receive veterans' disability compensation concurrently. Amendments to section 1413a(f) update the language. Effective date for these changes is specified. Combat-related special compensation eligibility is extended to Chapter 61 military retirees with less than 20 years of service. Amendments to section 1413a of title 10, United States Code, allow retired pay recipients to receive veterans' disability compensation concurrently. Combat-related special compensation eligibility is extended to Chapter 61 military retirees with less than 20 years of service. The amendments to section 1413a of title 10, United States Code, allow retired pay recipients with less than 20 years of service to receive veterans' disability compensation concurrently. The amount of payment for any month will be reduced if the retired pay exceeds a certain percentage of the member's years of service multiplied by the retired pay base. The effective date for these amendments is the first day of the first month after the enactment of the Act.
